pullRequest.title: feat(JOML): Migrate PlayerFactory
pullRequest.bodyText:
I ported over character spawning logic to JOML. I moved SpiralIterable to math and I also added added and deprecated attachChild in Location. The changes should be functionally the same from the old code. Do we want to move SpiralIterableto a different namespace is the place I'm using ok?
How to Test

create a new world
player should spawn without issue

commit.message: added spiral iterable and player factory

nodes.bodyText: Please write down why this is deprecated and what to use instead 😉
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -60,10 +63,23 @@ public static void attachChild(EntityRef parent, EntityRef child, Vector3f offse
         }
     }
 
+    /**
+     * attaches a child entity relative to another entity based off of the relative location
+     * @param parent
+     * @param child
+     * @param offset
+     * @param relativeRotation
+     * @deprecated

nodes.bodyText: What does "attach" mean exactly here? Will there be a connection between theses two entities in the end, or does it just update the child's location component relative to the parent's location component with given offset?
I think this method should also get the Javadoc description as above to help figure out what this method should be used for.
I think the documentation on this can be improved, but that's unrelated to this PR.

+ * The iteration starts in positive x direction. + *

+ * The iterating vector is reused. Do not attempt to store the instance e.g. in a collection. + * @author Martin Steiger + */ +public class SpiralIterable implements Iterable{

nodes.bodyText:
remove the author tag, we don't use them (anymore)

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * @author Martin Steiger

nodes.bodyText: You only deprecated the convenience method. The method above should be deprecated and replaced as well.
The spawnPos parameter could be a Vector3ic.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -152,15 +154,15 @@ private Vector3i findOpenVerticalPosition(Vector3i spawnPos, float height) {

nodes.bodyText:
I'd prefer manipulating single vector components using:
newSpawnPos.y -= consecutiveAirBlocks
I guess that's a matter of taste, just take it as something to consider.

I'm not sure about this one...
The client iterates over read only vectors. So he probably doesn't expect their value to change. Each next() call however, changes the value of the previously returned vector, since it's always the same instance being returned.
Therefore I think it would be cleaner to return new instance every time. (see next comment)

commit.message: cleaned up javadocs and minor tweaks to code
